articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris opened up a marginal two-percentage-point lead over Republican Donald Trump after President Joe Biden ended his re-election campaign and passed the torch to her, a Reuters/Ipsos poll found.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris leads Trump 44% to 42% in US presidential race, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told families of hostages held in Gaza that a deal that would secure their loved ones' release could be nearing, his office said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu says deal could be nearing for hostages in Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from two landslides in southern Ethiopia has jumped to 229 and could rise further as the search for survivors and casualties continued into a second day, a government official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Death toll from Ethiopian landslides jumps to 229, official says

articles.author: Mohammad Ponir Hossain
articles.description: The Bangladesh government is expected to formally accept on Tuesday a court ruling to lower quotas for state jobs, media reported, meeting a key demand of the students who had been protesting for days.
articles.title: After protests, Bangladesh government to formally accept ruling on job quotas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Tuesday praised the Vatican's efforts in seeking peace and releasing prisoners of war in talks with a senior official, a contrast from previous tensions between Kyiv and the Holy See.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy discusses peace, prisoners with senior Vatican official

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nearly a third of Ukrainians would accept some territorial concessions to Russia for a quick end to the war, a more than three-fold increase over the past year, although most still oppose giving up any land, a poll showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Poll says 32% of Ukrainians open to territorial concessions for quick peace

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Allende Miglietta
articles.description: U.S. Capitol Police arrested Jewish activists protesting against U.S. military support for Israel inside a congressional building on Tuesday, a day before Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is scheduled to deliver a speech to Congress.
articles.title: Jewish activists arrested during Gaza war protest in US Congress building

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: U.S. Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle resigned on Tuesday after the agency came under harsh scrutiny for its failure to stop a would-be assassin from wounding former President Donald Trump during a campaign rally, according to media reports.
articles.title: US Secret Service chief resigns following Trump assassination attempt, media report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States has invited the Sudanese army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces for U.S.-mediated ceasefire talks starting on Aug. 14 in Switzerland, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Tuesday.
articles.title: US invites Sudan's warring parties for talks, RSF to participate

articles.author: Jose Torres, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: About 3,000 people carrying bags, water and small children trod through intense heat along a highway in southern Mexico on Tuesday, traveling in two groups aiming to reach the U.S. border.
articles.title: About 3,000 migrants travel in caravans to US border, undeterred by crackdown
